ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Do you smoke cigarettes? (No if only smoke cigars, pipes, or chew tobacco)
Notes: 1=yes; 0=no

ElementDescription: Please rate your addiction to cigarettes on a scale of 0-100  I am NOT addicted to cigarettes at all = 0; I am extremely addicted to cigarettes = 100
On average, how many cigarettes do you smoke per day?
Notes: 1=0-5, 2=6-10, 3=11-20, 4=21-29, 5=30 or more cigarettes per day

ElementDescription: Usually, how soon after waking up do you smoke your first cigarette? (in minutes)
For you, quitting smoking for good would be:
Notes: 1=very easy, 2=fairly easy, 3=fairly difficult, 4=very difficult, 5=impossible

ElementDescription: After a few hours without smoking, I feel an irresistible urge to smoke
Notes: 1=totally disagree, 2=somewhat disagree, 3=neither agree nor disagree, 4=somewhat agree, 5=fully agree

ElementDescription: The idea of not having any cigarettes causes me stress
Notes: 1=totally disagree, 2=somewhat disagree, 3=neither agree nor disagree, 4=somewhat agree, 5=fully agree

ElementDescription: Before going out, I always make sure that I have cigarettes with me
Notes: 1=totally disagree, 2=somewhat disagree, 3=neither agree nor disagree, 4=somewhat agree, 5=fully agree

ElementDescription: I am a prisoner of cigarettes
Notes: 1=totally disagree, 2=somewhat disagree, 3=neither agree nor disagree, 4=somewhat agree, 5=fully agree

ElementDescription: I smoke cigarettes too much
Notes: 1=totally disagree, 2=somewhat disagree, 3=neither agree nor disagree, 4=somewhat agree, 5=fully agree

ElementDescription: Sometimes I drop everything to go out and buy cigarettes
Notes: 1=totally disagree, 2=somewhat disagree, 3=neither agree nor disagree, 4=somewhat agree, 5=fully agree

ElementDescription: I smoke cigarettes all the time
Notes: 1=totally disagree, 2=somewhat disagree, 3=neither agree nor disagree, 4=somewhat agree, 5=fully agree

ElementDescription: I smoke cigarettes despite the risks to my health
Notes: 1=totally disagree, 2=somewhat disagree, 3=neither agree nor disagree, 4=somewhat agree, 5=fully agree

ElementDescription: Cigarette Dependence Total score
Notes: Sum of all 12 items

ElementDescription: On the days you smoke cigarettes, how many do you usually smoke?
Notes: 1 = Does not apply; I do not smoke cigarettes at all; 2 = Less than 1 cigarette a day; 3 = 1 cigarette a day; 4 = 2 cigarettes a day; 5 = 3 cigarettes a day; 6 = 4 cigarettes a day; 7 = 5 cigarettes a day; 8 = 6 cigarettes a day; 9 = 7 cigarettes a day; 10 = 8 cigarettes a day; 11 = 9 cigarettes a day; 12 = 10 cigarettes a day; 13 = 11 cigarettes a day; 14 = 12 cigarettes a day; 15 = 13 cigarettes a day; 16 = 14 cigarettes a day; 17 = 15 cigarettes a day; 18 = 16 cigarettes a day; 19 = 17 cigarettes a day; 20 = 18  cigarettes a day; 21 = 19 cigarettes a day; 22 = 20 or more cigarettes per day (a pack or more of cigarettes a day)

ElementDescription: How soon after waking do you smoke your first cigarette?  (select one)
Notes: 1 = Within 5 minutes; 2 = 6-30 minutes; 3 = 31-60 minutes; 4 = After 60 minutes

ElementDescription: Over the PAST 3 MONTHS, how many times did you try to cut down or stop your cigarette  smoking?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once; 3 = 2 times; 4 = 3 or 4 times; 5 = 5-10 times; 6 =  Over 10 times

ElementDescription: Which of these best describes you? (mark one)
Notes: 1 = I have quit using tobacco and will never go back; 2 = I have cut down on or quit my tobacco use, but I still worry about slipping back, so I need to keep working on the changes I have made; 3 = I still use tobacco, but I will begin to change, like cutting back on the amount of tobacco that I use; 4 = I definitely plan to change my tobacco use, and I am ready to make some plans about how to change; 5 = I definitely plan to change my tobacco use, but I am not ready to make any plans about how to change; 6 = I often think about changing the way that I use tobacco, but I have not planned to change it yet; 7 = I sometimes think about changing the way that I use tobacco, but I have not planned to change it yet; 8 = I rarely think about changing the way that I use tobacco, and I have no plans to change; 9 = I never think about changing the way that I use tobacco, and I have no plans to change; 10 = I enjoy using tobacco and have decided never to change it = I have no interest in changing the way that I use tobacco.

ElementDescription: How much money did you spend on tobacco and other products containing nicotine in the past 30 days?
Notes: Amount in dollars

ElementDescription: Do you think you will smoke a cigarette in the NEXT SIX MONTHS?
Notes: 1 = Definitely yes; 2 = Probably yes; 3 = Probably no; 4 = Definitely no

ElementDescription: Here are some thinkings kids your age have said about smoking cigarettes. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Makes other people not want to be around you
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Here are some thinkings kids your age have said about smoking cigarettes. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Helps you stay thin
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Your best friend is vaping or smoking
Notes: 1= I would definitely vape or smoke; 2= I would probably vape or smoke; 3= I would probably NOT vape or smoke; 4= I would definitely NOT vape or smoke

ElementDescription: Vaping or smoking: You are bored at a party
Notes: 1= I would definitely vape or smoke; 2= I would probably vape or smoke; 3= I would probably NOT vape or smoke; 4= I would definitely NOT vape or smoke

ElementDescription: All your friends at a party are vaping or smoking
Notes: 1= I would definitely vape or smoke; 2= I would probably vape or smoke; 3= I would probably NOT vape or smoke; 4= I would definitely NOT vape or smoke

ElementDescription: Here are some thinkings kids your age have said about smoking cigarettes. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Relaxes you
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Here are some thinkings kids your age have said about smoking cigarettes. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Makes you do poorly in sports
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Here are some thinkings kids your age have said about smoking cigarettes. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Gest you into trouble at school (or work)
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Here are some thinkings kids your age have said about smoking cigarettes. How strongly do you agree or disagree with each statement? Helps you get away from your problems
Notes: 1=Strongly Agree; 2=Sort of Agree; 3=Sort of Disagree; 4=Strongly Disagree
